page.title: 09Population
page.content: The population of the area seems to be slowly falling.According to the 1981 census there were 13 less people than in 1971 and 175 less than one hundred years ago.The reason for this is probably that people have moved away from the area as their jobs on the land have gone to machinery.Young people often find that they have to go into York to find work.Even so there was less than 5% unemployment amongst men aged between 16 and 64 in 1981.This was lower than the rate for Easingwold.Nor were there a large number of old people beyond working age, less than one person in five in 1981, again fewer than in Easingwold.
